|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | The Chaos Knight is a plaything of Xom, subject to the god's constantly changing moods. Xom is a very unpredictable (and possibly psychotic) entity who rewards or punishes according to whim. They begin with a lightly enchanted leather armour, a simple weapon of their choice, and one of Xom's choice. |

**Chaos Knights** are warriors who serve [Xom](/Xom "Xom"), the unpredictable and psychotic God of Chaos. This is not a religion for the faint of heart, for Xom is a fickle, capricious deity who sees the chosen as personal playthings. Xom takes delight in their risks and misfortunes, and is quick to punish those who are boring. Chaos Knights who can keep Xom entertained (and survive) will find themselves showered with blessings... but their lives are more often painful and short.

Chaos Knights start with 100 '[piety](/Piety "Piety")', meaning that Xom is currently neutral towards them. This will quickly change, however.

## Contents

- [1 Preferred Species](#Preferred_Species)
- [2 Racial Restrictions](#Racial_Restrictions)
- [3 Starting Equipment](#Starting_Equipment)
- [4 Starting Skills and Stats](#Starting_Skills_and_Stats)
- [5 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [6 History](#History)

## Preferred Species

If you simply must play a Chaos Knight, the game recommends [Hill Orc](/Hill_Orc "Hill Orc"), [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur"), [Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk"), [Draconian](/Draconian "Draconian"), [Troll](/Troll "Troll"), [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn"), or [Gnoll](/Gnoll "Gnoll") as your species.

## Racial Restrictions

[Demigods](/Demigod "Demigod") cannot be Chaos Knights (or any other religious class).

## Starting Equipment

Some [species](/Species "Species") may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

- +0 [chaos](/Chaos "Chaos") [weapon of choice](/Weapon_of_choice "Weapon of choice") ([short sword](/Short_sword "Short sword"), [mace](/Mace "Mace"), [hand axe](/Hand_axe "Hand axe"), [spear](/Spear "Spear"), or [falchion](/Falchion "Falchion")) or [unarmed](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat").
- +2 [leather armour](/Leather_armour "Leather armour")
- [Scroll of butterflies](/Scroll_of_butterflies "Scroll of butterflies") (this does not affect whether [scrolls of summoning](/Scroll_of_summoning "Scroll of summoning") or butterflies are actually generated in the dungeon).

## Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' [aptitudes](/Aptitude "Aptitude").

- [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting"): 3
- Chosen Weapon's Skill: 3
- [Armour](/Armour "Armour"): 1 (+1 if Armour aptitude >= Dodging aptitude)
- [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"): 1 (+1 if Dodging aptitude > Armour aptitude)

Choosing Chaos Knight adds 4 to your starting [Strength](/Strength "Strength"), [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") and [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity").

## Strategy

This is in many ways a challenge class, as dealing with Xom makes your run through the [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon") even more of a crapshoot than it already is, especially if you choose not to spoil yourself by reading the Xom page!

Unlike other [gods](/God "God"), Xom's feelings about you don't progress in an entirely predictable or fair manner. You *do* get feedback when you've done something to please Xom, but if you're used to the "follow the Appreciates list, score piety, be rewarded" logic of other gods, you'll have to abandon it here. Even if you do everything "right" by Xom, the 'rewards' are still random, just somewhat better on average. For Xom fans, of course, that's all part of the fun!

## History

- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), Chaos Knights received a [piece from Xom's chessboard](/Piece_from_Xom%27s_chessboard "Piece from Xom's chessboard") instead of a scroll of butterflies.
- In [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), most backgrounds were buffed; Chaos Knights received a [piece from Xom's chessboard](/Piece_from_Xom%27s_chessboard "Piece from Xom's chessboard").
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), Chaos Knights started with 20 [gold](/Gold "Gold").
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), Chaos Knights started with a +2, +2 normal weapon of choice ([short sword](/Short_sword "Short sword"), [mace](/Mace "Mace"), [hand axe](/Hand_axe "Hand axe"), or [spear](/Spear "Spear")).
- In [0.7](/0.7 "0.7") and prior versions, Chaos Knights could worship Xom, [Makhleb](/Makhleb "Makhleb"), or [Lugonu](/Lugonu "Lugonu"). CK of Makhleb was particularly easy, and therefore was removed; CK of Lugonu was split off into [Abyssal Knight](/Abyssal_Knight "Abyssal Knight").

From CrawlWiki

Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
The Chaos Knight is a plaything of Xom, subject to the god's constantly changing moods. Xom is a very unpredictable (and possibly psychotic) entity who rewards or punishes according to whim. They begin with a lightly enchanted leather armour, a simple weapon of their choice, and one of Xom's choice.

Chaos Knights are warriors who serve Xom, the unpredictable and psychotic God of Chaos. This is not a religion for the faint of heart, for Xom is a fickle, capricious deity who sees the chosen as personal playthings. Xom takes delight in their risks and misfortunes, and is quick to punish those who are boring. Chaos Knights who can keep Xom entertained (and survive) will find themselves showered with blessings... but their lives are more often painful and short.

Chaos Knights start with 100 'piety', meaning that Xom is currently neutral towards them. This will quickly change, however.

  • 2 Racial Restrictions
  • 3 Starting Equipment
  • 4 Starting Skills and Stats
  • 5 Strategy

Preferred Species

If you simply must play a Chaos Knight, the game recommends Hill Orc, Minotaur, Merfolk, Draconian, Troll, Demonspawn, or Gnoll as your species.

Racial Restrictions

Demigods cannot be Chaos Knights (or any other religious class).

Starting Equipment

Some species may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

  • +0 chaos weapon of choice (short sword, mace, hand axe, spear, or falchion) or unarmed.
  • +2 leather armour
  • Scroll of butterflies (this does not affect whether scrolls of summoning or butterflies are actually generated in the dungeon).

Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' aptitudes.

  • Fighting: 3
  • Chosen Weapon's Skill: 3
  • Armour: 1 (+1 if Armour aptitude >= Dodging aptitude)
  • Dodging: 1 (+1 if Dodging aptitude > Armour aptitude)

Choosing Chaos Knight adds 4 to your starting Strength, Intelligence and Dexterity.

Strategy

This is in many ways a challenge class, as dealing with Xom makes your run through the Dungeon even more of a crapshoot than it already is, especially if you choose not to spoil yourself by reading the Xom page!

Unlike other gods, Xom's feelings about you don't progress in an entirely predictable or fair manner. You do get feedback when you've done something to please Xom, but if you're used to the "follow the Appreciates list, score piety, be rewarded" logic of other gods, you'll have to abandon it here. Even if you do everything "right" by Xom, the 'rewards' are still random, just somewhat better on average. For Xom fans, of course, that's all part of the fun!

History

  • Prior to 0.31, Chaos Knights received a piece from Xom's chessboard instead of a scroll of butterflies.
  • In 0.29, most backgrounds were buffed; Chaos Knights received a piece from Xom's chessboard.
  • Prior to 0.14, Chaos Knights started with 20 gold.
  • Prior to 0.13, Chaos Knights started with a +2, +2 normal weapon of choice (short sword, mace, hand axe, or spear).
  • In 0.7 and prior versions, Chaos Knights could worship Xom, Makhleb, or Lugonu. CK of Makhleb was particularly easy, and therefore was removed; CK of Lugonu was split off into Abyssal Knight.
